description.narrative: Sector: Agribusiness. Beneficiaries: 148 (including 103 women). Description: Les Jardins de lEspoir is a social enterprise that brings together 8 partners and 27 employees over 5 farms, practicing plant production, animal husbandry, fish farming, mushroom growing and waste recycling. To improve poor sales of their agroecological and organic products, Les Jardins de lEspoir will set up a collaborative organic minimart called SuperBio. It will bring together organic and agroecological products of all kinds (plant, animal, fishery, processed food, etc.) for everyday access in Cotonou.

description.narrative: This project will enable DJIGBODE to improve and expand their cassava processing and storage capabilities. The project will strengthen the groups production and organizational capacity. Production will be increase through training in improved production techniques and provision of appropriate processing equipment and facilities to ensure the womens safety as well as compliance with health and sanitation regulations. The womens management skills will be improved through training in business and financial management, cooperative life, and a strong emphasis on literacy and numeracy to enable the women to track their own production, take ownership of their activities, and make calculations to inform their day to day decisions

title.narrative: Ashoka | Organic Fertilizer Production Expansion Project

description.narrative: Sector: fertilizer. Beneficiaries: 114 (including 22 women). Description: ABC Grower addresses the lack of fertilizer access in Benin, which results in low yields of organic farming. The organization uses new technologies to create more efficient and sustainable agricultural solutions, having developed a range of 19 specific organic fertilizers for 14 different crops. The result is an increase organic farm production by 50%, lowering the production costs, and raising market competition to both non-organic and organic foods. The fertilisers are easy to handle and can be produced on a large scale. The organization has partnered with rural populations from surrounding communities to train them in applying their bio-mineralization technology to create eco-friendly business models.
